Reviews.Title: “Fee for parking, lots of moquitos”
Reviews.Author: dcilliers
Reviews.Content: The location is good, tucked in a quiet area southeast of the 8 and 163 freeways. I asked for two queens instead of the king suite reserved through Hotwire, and for some reason we were given a handicapped room, which was actually a bit cramped (you might expect it to be more spacious) - the furniture was too big for the width of the room (I don't think a wheelchair could pass between the beds and TV console and closet) and we didn't have a bathtub, which was disappointing with a small child. It was late enough we didn't bother to ask to switch. I was disappointed that they charged $8 for parking in an open lot in a non-downtown location. I booked on Hotwire and have written to them suggesting they mention "fee for parking" since more hotels that never charged before are starting to charge for parking. The jacuzzi was nice and the whole pool area is quite attractive, full of foliage in an interior courtyard surrounded by the rooms. Unfortunately my husband and I were eaten alive by mosquitoes at the jacuzzi (around 9:30PM at night) - management should look into spraying, perhaps after the pool closes. The breakfast area is very large and there is an attractive patio with tables to sit outside (same area as the pool mentioned above.) The selection was pretty good and included waffles and eggs with ham in addition to the usual toast, fruit, yogurt, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet and roomy”
Reviews.Author: yeye2121
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with my husband and 2 year old son. the room was roomy and very clean. There are so many restaurants around there that we didnt have to travel far for dinner. the pool is clean and wasnt crowded at all. we will be going back again!

Reviews.Title: “Woken at 12:30 am by guest services - worst customer service I have ever seen”
Reviews.Author: Oceansara
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel are the comfy beds. Aside from that the lace is terrible and if you have any other options do not stay here. Absolutely shocking - i made a phone call from the room as soon as i checked in, at 7 pm. At 12:30 am i got a call in my room from guest services demanding my credit card number over the phone. When i reminded how late it was the receptionist apologized but still demanded the number and that it could not wait. I explained i was on medication and that this was apalling and she proceded to say she was coming to the room to collect the card and the 38 dollars. She then hang up on me!I then had to wait up for over an hour for her to turn up. She never did. Seriously, for 38 bucks how can you jeopardize the guest experience. I hurt my back and im here to see a doctor which is the reason why im staying here. Front desk is aware of this and I have a wheel chair. I was put in a disabled room and there is no way you can even move a wheel chair in there. So if you,re into rude service, screaming kids at the pool, no room service and being treated like dirt then you,ll love this place. Don,t forget, they have some real comfy beds!

Reviews.Title: “Not coming back”
Reviews.Author: TravelfamAZ
Reviews.Content: We chose this location because we had stayed here in the past with family and it is close to other family that live there locally. It seems to be going downhill. Good location, close to the mall and other necessities, and yes - affordable. BUT -Rooms are small -noisy -maids knock on your doors between 8:30-9:30 to do your rooms -"free"breakfast is low budget and of poor quality -daily parking fee of $8 -"free" wifi is bottom of the barrel - very slow -the wear and tear is truly showing on this place and aside from the "new" flat screen LG tvs..that's the most modern touch to the place. We were there on business/leisure. We reserved a king suite. Upon checking in we were given keys to a room..went to the room to get in and it was answered by people already occupying the room! The gal up front had written down the wrong room #. Then we found out it was the room next door (right next to the 1st floor exit doors and pool? No thanks.) Another associate resolved the matter for us and put us in a different room. Better location, but the carpet had a huge kool-aid looking red stain on the green carpet right as you walked in the door. Had reserved the room on our business card no problem. at 11pm (yes 11 PM) we get a call from the gentleman working the front desk - demanding other form of payment because our card was declined. Not knowing what the problem was, I assured we would be down to solve the matter. He insisted I give him new card information over the phone? (excuse me?) He was very rude and accusatory over the phone and we totally felt disrespected. My husband went down and gave him another card to use while we sorted out what the deal was on the business account the very next day...and carry on! This was definitely our last stay at this place. It was just not a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fraud”
Reviews.Author: D B
Reviews.Content: On our way home from vacation our bank notified us that someone had fraudulently tried to use my card. The only place I used the card all week was at this hotel. Upon further discovery they charged my card 150.00 for "incidentals" when I had a prepaid room. It is not a likely that the fraudulent charge and unauthorized charge occurred at the same time without a connection. I have yet to reach the manager!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, decent location”
Reviews.Author: PatrickVeitch
Reviews.Content: Spent the first three nights of a family trip here, using it as a base to see Legoland and Seaworld. The hotel itself is fine (we had a room with a bedroom separated by a sliding door for the children, complete with bunk beds), has a good outdoor pool and spa, and a decent free hot breakfast. All in all nothing sensational, but clean, tidy, reasonable value and - assuming you don't miss the turn off from Mission Valley Fwy! - in a convenient location, only 5-10 minutes from Seaworld and maybe half an hour from Legoland.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and location.”
Reviews.Author: Verybasic
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was great. It had one king bed and a set of bunk beds for our teen-age sons. Each bedroom had its own flat screen tv. The room was updated and well kept. We stayed 3 nights and the room was very well taken care of. I thought the room rate was reasonable. They also served a hot breakfast every morning which we enjoyed. It is in a convenient location off of I-8. This location makes it very easy to get to most things including the airport in about 10-15 minutes or less. Just across I-8 are many restaurants, shops and a mall. The only negative to speak of is the $8 fee per night for parking. I know that alot of hotels in the area charge for parking, but it still is not right.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: zonie0531
Reviews.Content: The Comfort Suites Mission San Diego was clean and the property was pleasant. 1. The pool area never got cleaned, towels and trash laid around all weekend. 2. The hot tub was broke. Never saw anyone attempting to fix it. 3. We asked for extra towels, the House Keeping staff knocked once then just walked right in. I thought this was odd, unprofessional and totally inappropriate. 4. House Keeping was already trying to clean our room at 8:00 am in the morning. I thought this was odd, totally inappropriate. 5. I was disgusted that people were walking into the breakfast room with no shoes, adults and children alike. Not the Hotel's fault just an observation.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE IF YOU VALUE YOUR FAMILYS SAFETY!”
Reviews.Author: heidikedwards
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff gave out keys to another person to view our room while we were in it. After this episode frightened my children and upset my husband and myself, the hotel staff refused to do anything to appease the situation. Upopn checkout they even charged full price for the stay. After weeks of us having to "chase" the management, they finally issued a credit of $50 which was not even equal to one's nights stay. There mistake ruined our family vacation, due to very tired children who were afraid to sleep the next days events were a disaster. We booked 3 nights total, a credit of at least the one nights stay would have been fair upon checkout. If you value your peace of mind and your familys safety - DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Away from home”
Reviews.Author: Damon1488
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for work I have been at this hotel thru the mon-fri for 4 weeks. Having to travel for work is hard enough and these folks go the extra mile to ensure your comfortable and that's usually not the way other places operate, they don't give you lip service here. I like this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: 60retired_12
Reviews.Content: Great price for a 2 room suite with fridge & microwave + TV's in each . Sliding doors can seperate second room from bedroom with king bed. Sofa in second room is a hide a bed. Big pool great for kids+ hot tub for adults. Mission Valley Mall just min's away with good choice of restaurants. Staff very helpful. Free breakfasts had great variety & was best that we've had. Rooms could use some minor repairs but not VIP. Very pleased with stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wayne-Marlyne
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in this hotel for 6 nights. The room was clean and well maintained. All public areas of the hotel, lobby, pool area, etc. were also clean and well maintained. The breakfast was very good, including scrambled eggs and a breakfast meat, usually ham or sausage, as well as toast, cereals, pastries, etc. The food selection was efficiently replenished as necessary, and the area was kept very clean. Front desk staff were very friendly, and helpful with any questions we had. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some sprucing up”
Reviews.Author: spark1es18
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel for one night while visiting San Diego. We arrived at about 2:30 and waited for the front desk clerk to acknowledge our presence, which took a little while. We waited for about 20 minutes to check in, but the lobby was nice and cozy with a beautiful fireplace, with ice water and fruit available. Once we checked in and got to our room, we were very disappointed. The smell was terrible, very musty. We called the front desk to ask about a different room with 2 beds, but none were available. They offered to come spray the room to get rid of the smell, but couldnt move us. The other con about the room was the heater, the room was freezing and the very noisy unit didn't warm up the room even after 4 hours of running it. Other than that, the room was good. The bed was very comfortable and there was a nice flat screen tv, a fridge and a microwave, as well as free wifi and a decent complimentary breakfast. I might stay there again if the price is right, but I would bring some sort of air freshener just in case. The AC/heating unit needs to be replaced, and possibly the carpet, but overall it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Donna J
Reviews.Content: Having travelled over 5,500 miles to see Chris Brown in Chula Vista we were pleasantly surprised at the excellent value for money we received at The Comfort Suites. The room was very tidy, having a fridge was such a bonus! The staff were all really welcoming and helpful. The breakfast was amazing so much to choose from, and really gave us a good start to the day.

Reviews.Title: “Warm Welcome”
Reviews.Author: Alice M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 2 nights in Sept. 2011. My daughter told the manager Elizabeth about it being our birthdays when she made our reservations.. We were surprised that we were given an up grade to a suite with fireplace and jacuzzi tub also fresh flowers and a goodie basket. The staff were so friendly and made us feel welcomed. The bed was very comfortable. We would recommend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Richard M
Reviews.Content: very clean, fast check-in, friendly staff, front desk person,Sarika was extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for a family”
Reviews.Author: Momx4Arizona
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for a family of 6 visiting Sea World. We stayed in one of the suites with 2 queen beds and a pull out sofa. The sofa would not have been great for adults but worked fine for 2 small kids. Hotel was very clean, had a good selection of breakfast items and a good pool. The hotels location is near the freeway system and makes it easy to get to all the area attractions. There is a shopping area with many food choices across the overpass. Also a Denny's and Wendy's in walking distance. My only complaint was the old creaky elevator near the pool. Parking spaces are tight and it would be hard to fit a large SUV. Our minivan was a tight fit on weekend nights. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Most noisy roomsRip off couldn't sleep”
Reviews.Author: Petertawfik
Reviews.Content: If I can do less than a star I would have done it  Never take their first floor rooms mine was 103 which is the closest to the lobby I think I was right beside their break room as I kept hearing their talking all night and their slamming doors and in the am I am right beside their cafeteria  I couldn't sleep for the two nights I stayed  Very poor quality pillows and mattresses  Never ever here again

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: Roaddogg_BC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a couple of nights for our anniversary and had a comfortable and pleasant stay. The hotel staff were friendly and professional. Our room was clean. The breakfast buffet was a bonus to start off our mornings. The hotel is conveniently located near the major highways and is close to Seaworld and only a 15 minutes drive to the beaches, such as Pacific Beach. Also, there are restaurants within walking distance from the hotel including Denny's and Fuji Steakhouse. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience. Home away from home feeling.”
Reviews.Author: Cliff M
Reviews.Content: There are always plenty of complaints but never enough compliments. Well, I can't say enough about my stay here. I have been staying at ths Comfort Suites M-F for business for almost a year now. I have seen a tremendous transformation during this time from renevation, to services, to staff. And it has all been very positive. The front desk staff are always personable and eager to help. Sarica, Ashley, Divina always have a smile to share. Adam and Frederick are who I see at night after a day of business. They don't just hello in a passing fashion. They ask you how you are and how your day was. And even more important, they listen to your answers and boring stoires. Not an easy thing to do at 11:30 at night! The breakfast buffet has improved ten fold. I apologize for not knowing the lovely woman's name who has taken over this task, but she is doing a wonderful job. She's always helping guests and asking if everything is good for them. She works at such a frantic pace keeping coffee and juice plentiful, and keeping the buffet clean amongst the constant spills from us guests. And she always smiles. The housekeeping staff probably have the most thankless job of all. Well a warm hearted thank you to all of them. Everytime you pass them in the hallways they won't look away, or not look at you at all, they will say hello, and if the occassion arises, they will ask you if you have evrything you need. How nice. And the maitenance guys always give a wave hello...when their hands aren't full! The renevation of the hotel increased the visual appeal as well. And the rooms with new carpets, flat screen TV's, and wall paper, and wireless internet has made my stays even more enjoyable. The center point to all this improvement can be contributed to Elizabeth Ming, the manager. I have seen her involved at every stage of transformation this hotel has gone through in the past year. From the gardens, to the renovation of the building, to staff changes, she has been completely involved with every aspect of the hotels improvement. One thing that is small in the whole scheme of things, but in my opinion shows a great managerial decision, is the change in the parking permits that you hang from your car mirror. When I first started staying here, the permits were multicolored and glossy. Pretty to look at, but at what cost just to hang on your mirror. Well eventually, in a smart cost cutting decision (again in my opinion) was changing these placards to plain white with black print. That is looking out for the best interest of the hotel, and the guests. Great job! I want to thank each and every one for making my stay away from home, feel like home. You have my gratitude. Yours Truly, Cliff Merems

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay with easy access”
Reviews.Author: candminw
Reviews.Content: This hotel is has very easy access on and off the highways toward the harbor and toward Balboa park and Gaslamp district. It is clean with nice landscaping. Parking costs $7 per night. The outdoor pool is surrounded by the 3 story building and lots of trees so sun exposure is very limited. Don't plan on doing a lot of sunbathing. Breakfast was just OK - staff had a hard time keeping up with the demand for hot food items (eggs, bacon, sausage, etc) on any given day. But breakfast seating is plentiful and kept clean, with indoor and outdoor seating in the poolside courtyard. Flat screen tv in room but not all cable networks available and no high definition. Free wireless internet speed was adequate. We had no complaints about our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Room, Poor Management”
Reviews.Author: Robin Y
Reviews.Content: Since we had never stayed at a Comfort Inn, we decided to give them a try and booked a family suite ($150 a night). Not only was our room not ready upon arrival, they gave us a dirty one with the room falling apart. Soiled comforter cover on the king bed with cigarette burn holes and stains, dried liquid splattered on the wall, dirty drapes / drape draw pull fell apart, dirty tub, and a refrigerator with 2" thick frost. Despite several complaints to the manager, nothing was done until after 10 pm at night, and all that management would do is "apologize." We had booked the room for four nights and left after staying only one night. I would never recommend this place to anyone. I have numerous photos which I am going to send along with a complaint to my credit card company to dispute the bill. I cannot see how this place stays in business with such poor management.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly run - see my photos of "made" beds!”
Reviews.Author: cdhrdh
Reviews.Content: Bathroom light didn't work so we moved a lamp from the bedroom until 2 contacts with desk sent someone to repair it. No early check in was allowed so there was quite a line for 2 staff members to check in guests. I believe this was because the housekeeping was so poorly managed. One day our beds looked like they were made by a 4 year old. There was a bobby pin on our bathroom floor for all 3 nights (I haven't owned any in decades) and something spilled was not cleaned up. I don't know if housekeeping staff arrives earlier than their shifts or what but they were sitting around their table in the morning. The breakfast was very disappointing with terrible sausage and the first morning they ran out of orange juice early on. If they cared they could have dashed out and gotten some. The beds were comfortable and they did give us a quiet room on an upper floor as we requested. The glass doors separating the living area from bedroom did not provide any noise buffering. Other than that the place seemed well designed and in a great location at the junction of interstate 15 and 8.

Reviews.Title: “Solid midrange hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: TANSTAAFL1
Reviews.Content: This is 70s/80s motel / motor hotel (3 stories, exterior corridors) which has been updated somewhat (new front facade, secured, attractive courtyard, standard rooms divided into 2-room suites), is clean and well-maintained. The rooms are relatively small (cramped for our family of 6), but clean and in good repair. The dresser / media cabinets included adequate LCD TV sets but not many cable channels. There was a mini-fridge and microwave inside the parlor cabinet as well, but no table and only a single side chair. Beds, furniture and carpets are close to new; drapes, bedding and fixtures are a little tired, but clean and serviceable. The bathroom was spacious and well-appointed with lots of counter space; the shower was serviceable with good flow and plenty of hot water - but a decrepit fixed massage head that didn't work well on any setting. Wall-mounted A/C under parlor window was a little noisy; the bedroom is ventilated by an equally-noisy through-the-wall fan which draws cool air from the parlor - just OK. A hot buffet breakfast was included (sausage, eggs, biscuits & gravy, pastries, fruit, juices, make-your-own waffles, boiled eggs); the breakfast area / and adjacent courtyard seating was kept relatively clean and well-serviced, but was not spacious and became overloaded at times. Front desk service was friendly and efficient. The hotel is located just off the main "Hotel Circle" area, with easy access from I-5 & I-8; there are many chain and fast-food restaurants within walking and short (5 min.) driving distance. They charge $7 per day for permitted onsite parking - unusual for this class of hotel, especially in San Diego - it's on the hotel's website, but not on the Choice listing page. This appears to be eithjer a measure to keep guests from the adjacent LaQuinta out, or just a semi-hidden fee to bolster profits. At around $110 prepaid (plus the $7 daily parking fee) for a 2-bed-plus-sofabed suite, this hotel is a fair value (typical for San Diego in summer) in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped & Hard To Find”
Reviews.Author: wavemasher
Reviews.Content: I travel every two weeks to see my fiancée. I use the hotels with Choice Hotels International and I have enjoyed good value mixed with comfort in the past 32 trips. This trip fell below the mark. The room was cramped; I am a big guy at 6 foot 6 inches. The bed was worn-out and a $7.00 charge for parking. The maid service was poor with the bed being made the only after 2 nights never emptying the trash or replacing towels.The worst part was trying to find the hotel because there are 5 Comfort Inns in the area and using Google Maps, GPS, and Rand McNally all failed at finding the correct off-ramp and then the road where this hotel was located. The staff was nice, cordial and accommodating but I checked out due to the bed and found a better arrangement in Point Loma-lesson learned.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: avacation839
Reviews.Content: When I read some of the reviews, I'll admit I was frightened, but after staying the night, my family and I couldn't be happier. This was a great hotel, very well-kept, great staff, nice amenities, and nice and quiet (which you have to appreciate in a hotel). I love that the bathroom counter was very spacious. Also, the free breakfast was great-really recommend the waffles. Though I am used to two queens, my husband, daughter and I did sleep comfortably in a king, though it was not our first choice-sofa sleeper was broken (really my only complaint). Also, of 3 hotels, this is the only one with Nickelodeon (a big plus if you have a little icarly fan). Some people have criticized the parking fee, but I didn't think it was unreasonable, especially considering most hotels charge it, and it's a way of discouraging homeless people. Lastly, I had chosen another hotel that claimed it was much closer to Seaworld, and after a miserable night, that is how I ended up here. The lesson is, don't let distance be your deciding factor, turns out a lot of the area close to Seaworld is VERY shady (strip clubs, night walkers, adult shops everywhere), and this area didn't seem to suffer from that and because of the freeway, you get to the park extremely quickly anyways.

Reviews.Title: “worst front desk service you could ever imagine. total madness.”
Reviews.Author: layla89james
Reviews.Content: I read the previous reviews and they were all correct....the desk clerks and managers were horrendous. I booked 2 nights.the first night, the hallway to my room was unbelievably toxic as the floor was covered with a drop cloth and men were painting doors and walls. it was an unbelievable sight and i covered my nose and mouth with my coat and tried not to trip over paint cans, brushes and men as i made my way to my room. it was extremely noxious and hard to breathe and i am also allergic to strong chemicals. i wanted to leave but was so exhausted from the drive there and thought..well this is bad..but as long as i cover my face til i get to my room i might be okay. the next day i told the manager i was concerned that they may start painting the door to the room i was in and wallpapering (i had overheard some employees talk abotu wallpapering) ..she assured me they would n ot do this. i told her to please let me know if they were beucase then i would have to leave. she said it was a mistake that they ahd started to paint and they would definetly not be anywhere near my room. i said...'i don't even think i could handle it down the hallway any more..so if they are gonna be even a bit near me, than i would ahve to leave.' she assured me this was a one time error. the next day, i was on the phone with a friend i was planning on meeting. i told her i was feeling sick all of a sudden. it was weird i told her..my glands were swollen and it just came on all of a sudden. I didn't know why i felt tired but i lay down and 2 hours later woke up. i could barely breathe...my hands and arms were covered in a rash, i felt panicky and ran out..and almost hit a painter who was kneeling outside my door. apparently he had been working on my door while i was in it and the fumes had been wafting in for a long time. i was so angry that my health was being jeaporized in this manner. i ran to the manager ..she kept saying'oh no..they wren't supposed to do this! why are they doing this!" i didn't know i said..i just knew i had to get to another room fast. i was weak and felt sick. half hour later...no room..i'm still outside trying to breathe and crying,. i come in and one of the teenagers at the front desk says'oh my god..should i call an ambulance?" i guess i looked bad. no no...just get me a room..please... 20 minutes more i was sent through a just painted hallway past rooms with doors open to air out the toxic fumes...i ran into my room which also had a just painted door...oh god! i shut the door fast but didn't realize that all the fumes were INSIDE the room , hence all the open doors.. ran out...crying...called my fiance who was in an important meeting and he came back while i waited in an area outside. i called the manager and asked for a fan so i could get the fumes out as i was so weak and needed to lay down. nothign came...the maintainance guys were with me and talked to me while i was crying..they said these were extremely toxic fumes and they felt dizzy jsut passing the hallways. no manager would help...i wanted to leave and wanted my money back... they said i had to wait until tomroww to talk to the head manager... after all taht and more...the next day...the manager elizabeth ming refused to talk to me. i watied for a few hours and said i was promised she would talk to me if i waited until the next day. she refused...i argued ..i refused to leave until she came and talked to me..she refused...she came out of her office at one point, saw me..turned and slammed her office door. i asked for her name...first and lazst..the front desk 'staff' said they didn't know her last name. (!) i knew if i left i would never get my money back. i never did and elizabeth ming came out very defensive, and refused to help me..she mocked me..and almost was taunting..i am from LA and used to bad treatment but have never had anythign like this.. she has no idea waht she is doing.. no one really does..it is a shame becuase the hotel rooms themselves are nice...anyway..there is more..but its too much and soo unbelievable what came after..... bottom line; they have no idea waht they are doing...i

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: crzyblonde23
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend. The guy that checked me in had no clue what he was doing. There was another lady working there that appeared to be the manager but had no clue what she was doing, she couldnt even make room keys. We asked for a crib and we were told they would bring one up. About 2hrs later we still had not gotten it so we went down and they said they now didnt have anymore. Our keys stopped working and when we went to the front desk nobody even apologized. we had no toilet paper and after asking for some, we NEVER got any. They had no clean towels. Elevators broke. Parking was expensive. Upon checking in, i asked if i could pay cash and i was told by the manager that i could but it had to be when i checked out. I tried paying cash when i checked out and a different girl said i could not cuz they already charged my card and that i should have done it at check in. Nobody knows what they are doing and they are very rude. My husband called the manager after are stay and NEVER got a return call. My husband works at a hotel and we are not picky but this place is ridiculous. Not worth it even when we had a cheap rate. Worst experience ever!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel and Staff EVER”
Reviews.Author: Jiven716
Reviews.Content: We don't typically look to stay in high end hotels when traveling domestic in The States, more for a clean, safe place to rest our heads after long days tourism. The night before our flight, we came back to the hotel around 7 pm to change and go back out again, but decided, we'd stay in and get some rest before traveling home. Good thing we made the decision. Around 8 pm, a single man used his card key to enter our room while we were relaxing in our room. The man retreated and said he'd head downstairs to have his room changed. Shaken up, we went down to the front desk and the 'kid' behind the counter said he'd not checked in anyone and hadn't recently changed anyone's room key. At this point, I'm thinking we were the victim of an attempted robbery. I asked the 'child' behind the counter to speak to a manager about my concerns and there was no one there but him, Literally an inexperienced kid was left on site and that was it. His Managers don't like to be bothered at home was his explanation! Needless to say, our last night before flying back East was sleepless. The next morning, the Asst. Manager did speak with us, but she was basically powerless to do anything or make any decisions. We also found during the night that our lisc plate was stolen in the parking lot, so we had to file a police report. My husband has tried numerous times to contact the General Manager as we were instructed to do by the Asst Manager. She will not return phone calls or emails. Pathetic!

Reviews.Title: “Failed to deliver room to sleep 3 as promised 8-(”
Reviews.Author: David94724
Reviews.Content: The three person suite consisted of a king bed and a fold out couch. No sheets or blankets were provided for the couch. When asked, the "engineer" delivered some (unpressed) linen, but was not up to the task of actually making up the bed in a fashion that could be slept in. Asked for some sort of "make it right" gesture but none was offered. All efforts to complain higher up in the management structure were frustrated as this is, apparently an individual owner of a franchise and locating the franchise owner has proven to be beyond my abilities. I would not suggest staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice!”
Reviews.Author: efamilyof7
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights.We didn't get the rooms we reserved; the desk said the website should not have specified we could reserve rooms with bunk beds bcz rooms are on a first come - first serve. If that's the case, what's the point of reserving a room. And I agree with others that the rooms are cramped with large furniture. Our stay started out badly when I got into the room and we found someone's leftovers in the mini-fridge. Then I looked in the bathroom and there was blood and hair on the floor. I think the maid that folds the towels has long dark hair because every day we got new towels there was more long black hair in them. She should wear a hairnet. The TV's were indeed fuzzy. One of our rooms didn't have a remote but maintainance brought one when we called. The other rooms TVs could not get movies on it and half the channels didn't work. Most of the channels are shopping channels and local networks anyway; I don't know why they even have cable. The bathroom door would not shut and they never did fix that for us. They never had enough pool towels. The room towels were often stained and they never had enough for us. The doors are not sealed well. Lots of light and noise from outside comes in. Don't get a room by pool or ice machine. The breakfast is good but they only have limited quantities at a time and one person working the breakfast area. They are always out of warm food and coffee, never enough muffins & bagels & condiments and no one to keep spills off the floor or wipe the tables. You're not supposed to take food out of the breakfast area, but if it's a cold day there are not enough indoor tables. And what's with paying extra for parking?! That should be included in the room charge. The parking stalls are too close together and there weren't enough of them if you came in late at night. Then, some of them were blocked off by the painters. We would have left to another hotel but the hotel wouldn't refund us because we had pre-paid. We tried to get help from Visa since we went through their rewards program but they said they couldn't help us either. The only good things I can say is that this hotel is close to everything, (mall, freeway, Sea World, zoo, beach, restaurants) and the staff were nice and tried to help and the main beds are comfortable. If you can help it, stay away from the sofa bed if you are a teenager or older. Those mattresses are miserable. The new outside paint job is looking good. Hopefully, it's an indication that they are trying to improve this hotel, but for now, stay next door at La Quinta.

Reviews.Title: “Best for the money”
Reviews.Author: JohnF023
Reviews.Content: This moderately priced hotel offers a great place to put your head after a long day in San Diego. They offer a full breakfast (free), nice patio seating and a happy staff. The accomodations are great for the price. Nice pool for the kids. Centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Now have nowhere to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ronnmel
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at this location back in nov 2010 for a stay this June for the rock & roll marathon. When I called today to 2 of the 4 nights, Paul the person in reservations totally screwed up and changed the dates (he didn't say anything about the change while on the phone) when I got my email confirmation, within a minute of hanging up the phone, I called right back and was told there were no rooms available.....WHAT?!?! When I told them THEY screwed up the said "so? What do you want me to do about it?" and "well just cancel then" so now I will be driving 12 hours with no hotel to stay at the night before the race. THANKS PAUL!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: thonyasi
Reviews.Content: We had a good time at this hotel. The staff was friendly and courteous. The 'suite' was a little crammed, but ok. pros: close to a couple of restaurants - walk away distance to Bennihana, El Torrito, TGI fridays. Pools are well kept and clean. cons: parking. The two side of hotel parking is ok [have adequate space to get in/out of the parking space], but on the rear-side, it can get tricky if the car parked near you is an over-sized one. Overall, I liked our [me, wife and 2 toddlers] stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best hotel to consider staying at.”
Reviews.Author: emmerss
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through a third party and not directly through the hotel because it was half off. They give their guests what they pay for. The room was definitely not a suite but very clean and nice. The restrooms were for disabled guests and I hated having to be in the restroom, no pressure from the water, The removable shower head wouldn't stay up, and there was no counter space. In the main room was two beds. We ended up pushing the beds together for more room. The refrigerator wasn't cold at all and ended up eating our leftovers right before bed. I was awoken numerous times in the morning before 8 am by employees standing directly in front of our room and talking about maintenance issues (they were so loud we could hear them over the loud fan!) We didn't even attempt to eat the continental breakfast. There's also an outrageous $7 daily parking fee per vehicle.

Reviews.Title: “If with Rock & Roll marathon- stay somewere else”
Reviews.Author: team_mimi
Reviews.Content: Called this hotel because it was listed on the "preferred" list at the R&R. They WILL NOT honor the rate listed on the R&R website. My husband left countless messages and finally spoke to the "manager" Elizabeth Ming. When we faxed AND emailed her a copy of the web page she STATED she would honor the price. She took our credit card information and told us she would email us our confirmation. Two months, countless calls and emails later and....SHE BLEW US OFF and NEVER reserved our room. if you are attending the 2011 Rock & Roll Marathon STAY SOMEWERE ELSE.

Reviews.Title: “Worn rooms but brand new flat screens”
Reviews.Author: jeffdblak
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at this location and due to it's price of under 100.00 it fits my budget. On my first stay the room was spotless, unfortunately this time around I can see that they just ripped out the old TV's because there is particle board shaving from the entertainment center all over the furniture and part of the carpet...the good news is brand new flat screen..the bad news is that the front desk told me that there were no remote controls for the new HDTV's and you could not change the channels...it was programmed on the welcome screen. So the rooms are worn with sagging couches nicked and torn wall paper, old furniture and brand new HDTV's that are useless...I think I'll look elsewhere on my next business trip to San Diego. I am a Platinum Choice Hotels member and stayed over 25 nights with Comfort Suites across the Western US last year and this is not the standard of every other CS I have stayed at..this should be a Comfort Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is okay”
Reviews.Author: lovebug123
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel over Thanksgiving. I can tell you traveling with two young children, this hotel worked out well for us. I love the kid's suites. Very convenient. However, the "suites" are somewhat small. The fact that you have to walk through the kid's room to use the bathroom was a pain too. We had to tip-toe in the middle of the night. The room was a bit stinky at first. But.... once I asked the maid to please change all the linens and deodorize the room, she did, and it was much better. The breakfast was better than expected compared to other hotels we have stayed in. It gets crowded early so we were there by 7:30 to beat the crowds. Our keycard did not work for our room several times so we had to travel to the front desk a lot, but they seemed to make the effort to fix the problem. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for the price. If you want to go to sleep early, try not to get a room by the pool. It is open until 10pm and there was always kids in the pool, even though it was like 40 degrees! Yikes! The hot tub looked nice and the hotel seems to be well-maintained. It is only a ten minute drive to Sea World so the location was perfect for us! Even though it is right off the freeway, you don't really hear the noise. Good hotel for kids and bigger families but would not recommend for couples or singles who need rest.

Reviews.Title: “ok..but for a "suite" alittle cramped”
Reviews.Author: t-m-c-m
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights. We have during our 2 week vacation stayed in several "suite" rooms, and although this room was big there was not much space becaused of all the chunky furniture (by that I mean the large wardrobe/TV units/desk and coffee tables) - if the furniture was updated the suite might seem more spacious. The TV's were old fashioned and need replacing. Room was clean and bed ok. Internet worked well. Although hotel is near busy roads, we were not disturbed by any road noise. There are plenty of eateries around and the Mall is close by. Breakfast was ok, nothing special - there were 2 hot items available (egg & sauasage) We had no problem with the parking, although not too happy having to pay for it, but seems most places charge to park in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Car Vandalized on Property and No action taken by General Manager”
Reviews.Author: SDTraveler82010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Inn for 5 days and spent over $1000.00 in lodging costs etc... When we returned from Sea World one night, there was only one parking space available towards the back of the lot, which we parked in. I noticed a body in a broken down car next to where we parked. Apparently, the security there is not "real" since it is clearly stated that the parking lot is for hotel guests and not homeless people or convicts that need a place to park there cars and sleep. I reported this to security and the front desk and then came out in the morning to find that my car was covered in human spit and feces...yuck, disgusting, unacceptable. As it turns out, the security guard asked the homeless convict to leave the premises. He then returned later to seek his revenge for being kicked out. The hotel charges a daily parking rate and claims the premises are secure... What a joke. The General Manager, Elizabeth Ming who I spoke with, offered to reimburse me for 1 night's parking fee for my "inconvenience". What an insult and really poor management. She would also not provide any information regarding whom she reports to. Needless to say, they make money on parking at their hotel and spending money to stay there and then provide no security to back up their claims. I would not recommend staying there. Also, the beds were really uncomfortable and we found a dead bug in the fold out sofa bed. Also, they were completly out of towels one night when we returned from a day of leisure. BEWARE...STAY AT YOUR OWN RISK

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is getting worn and has poor customer service with attitude”
Reviews.Author: SJL4
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this property as it was listed as a three-diamond under AAA ratings and had bunk beds for my two young children. This hotel is not as nice as advertised. The room I had showed its age as it was looking dirty and worn. I also had one of the worst experiences I have ever had with the hotel personnel and management. Their customer service was very poor. On the second night of our stay the Toilet backed up a around 8:30 P.M. I called the front desk and was told there was no one who could fix it so I could move to another room. I declined this, as it would have taken at least an hour and a half to pack up, move, unpack and set up the room. My children were just going to bed so moving and doing the work would have been quite intrusive. I couldn’t believe that they didn’t have anyone who could plunge the toiled as this hotel has over 125 rooms. I asked if they had a plunger and the desk person stated he would look. He later called and stated that he couldn’t find one. (really) I could use the bathroom six rooms down for the night. I advised that this was unacceptable, as it would be disruptive as the kids would probable get up a couple of times. He stated that no one else was there and the manager didn’t answer the phone and he couldn’t’ find the plunger. I went out and purchased a plunger. When I returned it took me all of 30 seconds to have the toilet operating properly. At around 9:00 the next morning I went in and asked to see the manager. She refused to meet with me and advised the employee that she was on a conference call and wouldn’t be available to meet until 2:00. I found this to be ludicrous and told the clerk so. I felt like making a scene but didn’t as my children were there. When we returned from our day at Seaworld around 5:00 I met with the manager. She told me that it was good customer service to only offer a room change. I advised her of how much work it would that would have caused, and how disruptive it would have been to the young children and that it only took me a few seconds to fix the problem after I went out and bought the plunger. I told her she should be embarrassed about the customer service, she advised that she was proud of it and all of her employees. I asked for information on the ownership of the hotel, or her manager. She only would give me the “choice” 1-800 number. She actually stated that she didn’t have that information. I asked for the name of who hired her she stated "herself", I asked if she was the owner. She again would only say she didn’t have that information. Earlier I had asked for compensation for the situation she insulting only offered to pay for the plunger. In the room was a card titled “commitment to your Satisfaction,” It stated states that “if you’re not satisfied with our accommodations or service, please the front desk know so we can make it right.” At this property from the general manager on down they do not follow this policy. They definitely did not “make it right.”

Reviews.Title: “Manager promised to refund, but no refund & no answer for 40 days.”
Reviews.Author: kayla002
Reviews.Content: I stayed this hotel with my husband and two kids. They promised me to get the room with two queens( I confirmed on the phone two times), but when I arrived, they gave us the smallest room(one king bed). My husband had to sleep on the floor with roller bed. Actually there was no space for roller bed, so we moved table in the bathroom to make space for roller bed. Anyway, next morning, the manager promised to refund 50%, but they never refund it, and never answered my emails for 40 days.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for!!”
Reviews.Author: azjim66
Reviews.Content: Stayed her over Labor Day weekend. The Pros: It is a great location to to explore San Diego and very quick access to Sea World. Lots of restaurants across the freeway at the mall area. We really like Ruby's Diner!! The Cons: Hotel is very dated. We had a two room suite with bunk beds in one room and a king in the other. The rooms are very small and when the sliding door is closed no AC gets in the other room. There is a small fan the push air through but it didnt work. The adults have to walk through kids room to use bathroom. The free breakfast is nice and ok for kids but it thats it..kind of a rat race with people breathing down your neck to get to the waffle maker. There seemed be alot of less than disreable people at this hotel, and one night @ 2 a.m. we were awoke to some chick pounding and kicking on our door..I kindly responded and advised her in my best east coast lingo that it would be in her best interest to move along..she complied immediately. Overall we had a great rate and got what we paid for....wasn't expecting the Ritz Carlton but needless to say was very disappointed and won't be returning or recommending.

Reviews.Title: “Poor...”
Reviews.Author: susyu
Reviews.Content: This hotel was dated, the rooms dark and dingy and quite frankly dirty. We stayed with our two young children for eight days and the rooms were barely touched by housekeeping. Although the beds were made up, nothing was wiped or cleaned and we had to contact reception on several occassions to have our towels replaced. (something you would expect on a daily basis) Breakfast seating was inadequate, and queues for poor quality food were a daily occurrence. I understand that this is a budget hotel, however even with that consideration made, I would strongly reccommend that this place be avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: travelingm0m2008
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean. The location was very convenient. The free breakfast was pretty basic, but it was free, and perfectly adequate. Most of the staff was friendly and courteous. Our rooms were spacious, with microwave and mini fridge in each. Beds were comfortable. Maid service was prompt. The pool was a bit small, and it got crowded in the evenings - lots of kids! A great vacation, and a great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: rydel12
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just ok. The rooms are decent but nothing more. The pool is small but I guess adaquate for kids. The walls are paper thin and we were awake every night by people walking in the room above. If you want quiet choose a room on the 3rd floor and away from the pool. The complimentary breakfast is just ok also. I love my breakfast and this was not that good at all. Eggs and sausages were not edible. At least there was cereal and milk. The location is good as there are several big shopping malls around. The zoo and sea world are close also. Ralph's grocery store is also not far. You do need a car in san diego though.

Reviews.Title: “this place ruined our vacation”
Reviews.Author: msqaz
Reviews.Content: You have to leave the door between the 2 rooms open to alow any air in the bedroom area...the fan in the wall made noise all night long...no one was confortable...sleeps 6???NO there was no room to walk around...we only had 5....breakfast was the SAME SAME SAME every day...eggs were powdered eggs...bread was stale and it took for ever to make waffles....the elavator took FOREVER....it was broken the whole stay....theey were not acomadating to handicap at all...DON't STAY HERE

Reviews.Title: “Good location; deceptive name”
Reviews.Author: deedeeSoCal
Reviews.Content: First, the location of the hotel was great; the front desk staff was pleasant; the bathroom was clean. We always found parking, although there is a $7 daily charge. Free wifi worked well. This was a Hotwire reservation, and we were treated accordingly. Although the hotel website shows and describes SUITES only, they give third-party guests (Hotwire, Priceline, Expedia) lower quality rooms. Our room had two queen beds, two small chairs, a small table, a tv/dresser/microwave/refrig piece, and a wardrobe, in a very small room. The bathroom was equipped for handicapped, and there was no counter, no place to put your personal items except on the floor or the windowsill. The hand-held shower was broken; my husband fetched tools from the car and fixed it so we could stand under the showerhead. The bathroom was large to accommodate a wheelchair, but inconvenient otherwise. The room was dark, without enough lighting, and we could not open the draperies since the room faced the pool/spa and people were standing around outside our door/window from morning until 10pm. Breakfast was adequate, although seating was limited since there were many families there. Staff kept the food stocked and tables cleared. Bed was okay, although one sheet was torn. I asked the desk clerk at checkout if they always gave their third-party guests that room, and she said that to get a "suite" you would have to upgrade with the hotel; so basically, yes. It was okay since we didn't pay full price, but I find it offensive when a hotel advertises something that it does not give to all its guests.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Adequate”
Reviews.Author: nmwritergal
Reviews.Content: Wow, people are awfully picky, complaining about square pillows, bitterness over the lack of weekday waffles, and the size of the room. Seems as if people expect a palace whether they are paying 30 bucks or 300 bucks. The bed had 5 pillows, plenty for two people; yes, the room was on the small size, but it's not like you had to turn sideways to walk; it had a fridge, microwave, couch, desk, easy chair, dresser, armoire, bedside tables with lamps and a large bathroom. It is a tiny bit shabby (peeling wallpaper, rip on the arm of the couch, holes in the top sheet) but it was clean--no bedbugs in sight--and a decent place to stay for the price, The pool and spa are outside and were quite nice. It is a little noisy, but better noise from kids than drunken adults.

Reviews.Title: “BAD BAD BAD stay away”
Reviews.Author: e271msh
Reviews.Content: stay away from comfort suites. stayed with husband and small daughter and had the worst experience. the room was small and dimly lit. the sink was leaky. And the worst ... My husband woke up the next day with back full of bug bites. we left the very next day and checked into another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “loved the laid back atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: ChiquiChiqui
Reviews.Content: I read mixed reviews prior to leaving on this trip, but have to say that I would stay here again when I go back to San Diego! All of the staff I encountered were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was basic - expected that. There are not any public computers to use, but front desk was more than willing to check us in for our flight and print our boarding passes! Spent every night of our stay at the hot tub......loved it! You always have to remember you get what you pay for....if you want a 5 star hotel, pay for one!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Small Suites”
Reviews.Author: octwinmommy
Reviews.Content: We wanted to be close to Sea World so we could run our under 2 year olds back for a nap. Check in was easy and friendly. Our room which was called a suite was very cramped and the two cribs we requested took up most of the space. It did ultimately give us the little separation we needed. The decor of the rooms is a little tired but everything was very clean. The pool was also well maintained. The free breakfast they offered was OK but the staff was slow in replenishing and their was always a line for the waffle station. Overall, I liked the location (tons of shopping and restaurants very close) and Sea World was a quick drive as well!

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected based on other reviews”
Reviews.Author: griswojw
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Comfort Suites in Mission Valley. We stayed for 7 days and definitely felt we got our monies worth. My wife and I have an 8 month old daughter, so it was important to have sectioned place where we could be to let her get her naps in, yet allow us someplace to watch TV, etc. The King Site worked perfect. We were close enough to hear her wakeup, yet separated enough that we were not disturbing her naps. The rooms were clean and serviceable. The staff was very courteous and resolved a minor maintenance issue quickly. We had a room on the 3rd floor that faced away from the main road, so traffic was never an issue. Not sure if other rooms were a noise problem, but never heard any complaints from anyone at the free breakfast buffet. The breakfast food was great. They always had a meat (typically sausage) and an egg, as well as muffins, croissants, cereal, orange juice and do it yourself waffles. Even if you were one of the last ones there, they tried to keep everything stocked. The pool was perfect to unwind at the end of a long day and the hot tub looked inviting as well. There are several restaurants within walking distance and if you show your room key, they’ll give you 15% off. We would definitely stay at the Choice Suites in San Diego again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay, surprised with bad reviews.”
Reviews.Author: erinvic
Reviews.Content: This Comfort Inn was on the pricey side for us. But, it was a nice, clean place. The staff was friendly. My kids loved the pool, and the spa was nice and hot!! The room was the normal "two room suite" that most hotels advertise. It's just a sliding door separating two areas, and that's how most hotels are when they say "suite". We definitely weren't expecting bedrooms like others in posts below. We do travel very often. The breakfast area was extremely busy both weekend mornings and that was the only annoying thing about our stay. But, the breakfast was better than most places we stay and there was a big selection. Our Choice Privileges Rewards got us a free night out of this 2 room stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, and don't plan to use an Amex Gift Card to pay!”
Reviews.Author: KatamiSoCa
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at this hotel. When we checked in, my husband verified that we could use an American Express Gift card for payment. The clerk said she had dealt with them before and although we could not use the card to secure the room fees while we were there, they would call to verify balance and then proceed. She led us to believe this was standard practice. When we went to check out, another clerk at the front desk said that it was company policy not to accept any card that did not have a name on the card. My husband had shown the card to the previous clerk and she seemed to have no issue with use using it but the clerk at check out refused. This was just one issue with this hotel. The breakfast is not good; the sausage patties were greasy and undercooked, the muffins were of poor quality and the most popular item was the waffle machine. It would take about 2 minutes for each waffle and guests would hog the machine and so it was difficult to get either of the 2 just to make one waffle. For paying $189 per night, this was not a good value. We've stayed in better places for half the price! Rooms are old and the one elevator was very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot Reccomend”
Reviews.Author: Finzphan
Reviews.Content: The room itself was average. Not horrible, but nothing to get excited about. Comfortable enough for the family (we had the two room "suite"). Basically a standard room with a sliding door dividing the bedroom from the sofa couch. The continental breakfast was poor. A very limited selection of a couple of cereals, toast, bagels, mini danish, and one fruit (apples). Come to find out they only have the waffles on weekends. Nothing special about the staff. Not unfriendly, but they just seem content on making a paycheck. And by the way, seven bucks a day to park is a sore spot for me. I missed it on the web page, but it's not even valet or garage parking, just the lot they've always had. A bit of a ripoff IMO. There are two many other option out there to consider this again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: boontz
Reviews.Content: The week before our stay at Comfort Suites in Mission Valley we stayed at La Quinta INN right next door. We had a terrible time there, the cartpet was sticky, the free breakfast was crowded and inadequate and the room was cramped. So we decided to look for another Hotel to stay at. The pictures posted in the Comfort Suites websites looked very good so we decided to stay there. The room that we got was very small. What was suppose to be a two bedroom suite was a room divided into two. The air conditioner was in one room and there is a fan in the wall to move the air from one room to the other. The fan was noisy and you can't turn it off. The sliding bathroom door didn't have a lock. The fridge did not have a freezer. The furniture was old and scratched. The sofa bed stretch all the way to the desk so there is no room to move around. This was just the room. Parking was seven dollars a night. There were bird poop on my car. The breakfast was even worst than La Quinta. The waffle machine was only out during the weekend. They served boilded eggs when ever they feel like it. The pastries and fruits was not like the pictures. There were only bread, bagels and 2 or 3 different types of pastries. Sausages and what looked like fried eggs were served only on the weekends. I saw a kid drink coffee because there were nothing else that he liked. I would never stay at this hotel ever again and I would have to think twice about staying at another Comfort Suites. This hotel makes La Quinta a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not so "comfort"able”
Reviews.Author: Wonders19
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently took our 3 kids (ages 7, 5, and 2) and stayed in a Kids' Suite for 8 nights. The overall experience was so-so. It did serve it's purpose to provide us with somewhere to sleep and store our stuff while we were out all day, but I know the next time I go to San Diego, I will book another place. The location was OK - close to the airport, Sea World, SD Zoo, and the beach. There's also a shopping mall reallly close by, along with several restaurants. But here are the problems that I had with this place: 1. They advertise waffles for breakfast, but they didn't tell you it's only on Saturday morning. I originally picked this place over other comparable facilities is becaues of their advertised waffle bar breakfast. Their normal breakfast consist of toast, bagels, pastries, cereal, milk, OJ, cranberry juice, coffee/tea. On Sunday they add eggs and sausage patties. 2. The pillows and mattress were REALLY uncomfortable. My husband descrived the pillows as bags of giant cotton balls. For the king size bed, instead of the normal 2 king-sized pillows,they give you 5 square throw pillows. 3. The TV cable to the kids' room cuts in and out. We had to fiddle around with the cable to get a somewhat clear reception. 4. The front desk clerk was RUDE. She didn't even know their own Sea World fun pass promotion when I asked her and told us to call Sea World ourselves...umm, it's a special that's advertise on your website, hello!!! 5. The toilet did not flush properly. We had to hold the lever down for the toilet to do a complete enough flush. 6. The shower head was really sub-par. The water pressure was horrible, though the water stayed hot while all 5 of us showered or bathed. 7. The water in the pool was somewhat cloudy. My husband attributed this to the fact that everyone was probably wearing sunscreen, but I think it's just gross. 8. They charged for parking. 9. The wall/door did not cut the noise out. Late at night we could hear the noisy pool people in our room while we tried to go to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Served it's purpose”
Reviews.Author: LoveThePhoenixSun
Reviews.Content: The photos make the "suite" look larger than it is. As other guests mentioned, it is one average sized hotel room with a wall and a sliding door separating the two rooms. We had a King suite. I don't know if all of the rooms are set up this way, but a downfall was the A/C was in the living room area (where our young child slept) and a wall fan blew air into the King suite. Our daughter's side was nice and cool (where the A/C unit was) and our side was a bit stuffy. Thankfully, we packed a small fan! I also took another guest's advice and packed some lavendar linen spray, as the hotel did have a "smell" (damp/urine smell). It was very obvious the first day, but it seemed to be better as the days went on. Overall, this hotel served it's purpose. We were only in the room for our daughter's naptime and to sleep at night. Thankfully, we did not have a pool view room, because it would have been very noisy. There were big kids in the pool until 10 (maybe even later) each night and they were quite loud. The bed and bed linens were very comfy and it was wonderful to see plenty of pillows and soft, clean towels available! The breakfast was ok. We are not big breakfast eaters, so a bagel and piece of fruit was fine for us. There were eggs, sausage, waffles, muffins, and pastries but we did not try any. The one thing that really bothered my husband and I was the awful water pressure in the shower! We jokingly said we hoped Shamu would splash us, so it really would feel like we got a shower that day! In summary, the hotel was clean, the staff was very friendly, the location was convenient (gas, mall & restaurants nearby).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful on the outside.....however...”
Reviews.Author: cruiselover801
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location. Close to freeway, but not so close that it's noisy. The outside of the hotel and lobby are beautiful. The front desk staff was the best! Very helpful and professional. The pool was nice. Located in the center of the complex and surrounded with lush vegetation. The room was described as a two room suite. The room was actually a large single room divided by a sliding french type door. The a/c was located in one end of the room and once the sliding door was closed it made the other sleeping area stuffy. The king bed was comfortable, but the murphy bed (pull out sofa) was not at all comfortable. The room was dated, carpet was loose and dirty, and the worse part was the smell in the room. The smell was a urine/mold smell that was bad enough to where it woke me in the middle of the night. Fortunately, I'd packed a bottle of Fabreeze and used it to get rid of the smell. There was a $7.00 per night charge for parking. The hotel we stayed at earlier in the week didn't charge for parking. We talked to another couple at the hot tub and they told us they had the same exact room (Friday night stay) and paid $60.00 less than what we paid. The pool and staff were wonderful, but I would not recommend this hotel due to the smell and cost. We stayed at three different hotels while in San Diego and this one was the most expensive and dirtiest. Yes, they did have a continental breakfast, but that breakfast wasn't worth the higher cost of our stay. The next time we visit San Diego we'll look for a hotel that gives us a better value for our money.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: pepsipeople
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 night with our two young kids. We had the room with the king bed and the bunk beds. This worked great for us and the kids loved it. The divider didn't block any noise. Both rooms had a TV and lots of dresser space. Had a microwave and fridge. Room was quiet at the back of the hotel. Pool and hot tub were fine but very small pool towels provided. Breakfast included muffins,danish and a toaster for bagels/toast. Juice/coffee/tea. Saw some fresh fruit on the last day (apple/bananas). The high speed connection was free and worked well. Parking was $7/day. Close to shopping and lots of resturants. For the $49 a night deal we got on Hotwire this hotel was a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: jlund
Reviews.Content: I had a 5-night stay at this hotel during a business trip. During my stay I was interviewing people in my room and the suite part came in handy. The King suite I had was smaller than other Suite hotels but nonetheless, charming. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful, especially Laura at the front desk. She always greeted me by my name each time she saw me. The lobby is very cozy and well decorated and you can enjoy their coffee bar there 24/7 as well. The breakfast was well stocked and there was plenty of space inside as well as on the patio. My only complaint was that the air conditioner had a funny smell to it, which didn't bother me all that much since I was there in November. This hotel is in a busy area, with nearby restaurants that you can walk to but any of the outside noise didn't bother me, and I was towards the front of the hotel. I had a great experience at this hotel and I would recommend it and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, great location, NOISY!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyguyVancouver
Reviews.Content: We booked one of the "suites" for 4 nights with my wife, 2 year old son and a friend. The friend was to sleep in the pull out in the "separated" room. The rooms are only separated by a sliding french door, so don't really give any privacy and do nothing for sound. All the staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast is quite good with GREAT waffles that you make your self on this nifty waffle maker. The eggs taste like they are powdered eggs that were made 6 hours ago, but are still edible. Very kid friendly hotel, lots of families around. I would recommend going to sleep early as the walls, floors and seems doors are paper thin. In the morning you can hear EVERYTHING going on. You can hear the kids screaming next door, the wife yelling at the husband to get ready across the hall and the cleaning staff vacuuming down the hall. Room cleanliness is good, bathroom was quite nice and they have nice comforters and pillows on the bed. All in all a nice hotel, probably would not stay there again due to the noise in the morning. Location is good with freeway next door (no you can't hear the freeway from the hotel) so access to Zoo, Sea world and downtown is only 10 min away.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, good price and location”
Reviews.Author: WilliamSDiego
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews before I stayed there, I decided to give it a try. The room was ok nothing fabulous, a little towards the old side. Service and breakfast were typical. Everything in their ad was up-to-date. The location is perfect! Only down side was the noise from the kids, but that was the risk I had to take.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean/courteous”
Reviews.Author: charlen60
Reviews.Content: Quiet place. 25 min walk to trolley. Central location. Spotless. Close to freeway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: WeloveSanDiego
Reviews.Content: Family of 4, with one teen and one small child, this hotel was very affordable, clean and close to everything. We stayed in the 2 dbl bd suite. Our teen stayed up much later than us, watching his own TV in the living room, and using his laptop, while we slept. Extra pillows and blankets in the room a plus. The marble countertop bathroom much nicer than some 4 star hotels. Very large and modern. The free parking and free breakfast was great. Make your own waffles, fresh fruit, muffins, bagels, toasters, juices, teas, cereal, eggs. There was a nice patio area outside to eat, as well as ample seating inside. The pool was clean, the grounds quiet. We very much enjoyed not wasting $100 more a night at a Sheraton or Hilton, where you have to pay $20 or more for each night parking too, and $30 per person breakfast. It was a great stay -cation for us With the money we saved vs. Sheraton, we had dinner at Benihanas which was in walking distance. Great location, and best option for a family with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Definitely a Family Oriented Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nthsh01
Reviews.Content: We were a bit concerned after booking this hotel, after reading some of the negative reviews. However, our experience was very positive. A little hard to find at first, but that's not their fault, the road network in this part of San Diego is a bit complicated, with many parallel side roads, and many long traffic lights. Our room was a "suite," with a bed in the main portion and a small loveseat and desk in the smaller portion. Somewhat tight quarters, but it worked fine for us. The free wireless internet was much appreciated, as were the abundance of towels they provided. The overall condition of the room was very good, there was some mold on the wallpaper and ceiling in the bathroom, but the room was clean and not too worn. Parking was plentiful, the staff very welcoming and helpful, and the continental breakfast was suprisingly varied and pretty good. Make your own waffles, a variety of cereals, fruits, bread and muffins....something for everyone. Downside: MANY families with children, and if this bothers or annoys you, you may want to avoid this hotel. This is definitely their target market, so be warned. We visited in the off season, so it likely wasn't as manic as in the summer, but the breakfast room was still a trial over the weekend, as unfortunately, many parents have not taught their children "buffet etiquette." Then again, it was obvious many of them didn't know it either. Overall, a very good experience with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel for family with 2 young kids”
Reviews.Author: clb0817
Reviews.Content: Let me tell you that we did not like this hotel at all! I originally researched hotels in the San Diego area long before our trip. This hotel had positive reviews, and the kids’ separate room was a humongous bonus, it seemed. My 4-year-old could sleep on the bottom bunk, and his 2-year-old sister in a pack-n-play in the same room, while we (my husband and I) slept in the master bedroom. I don’t think I did my research well enough! While the price was doable (about $179/night), the room itself was awful. When I first walked in I immediately noticed how tiny the room was. I opened the main door, which immediately puts you into the “master” bedroom. The bed took up practically the entire space. There was also an armoire with a tv on top, a mini-fridge, and I think a tiny microwave. There was practically no counter space to set things down, no place to set our suitcases without unpacking everything into drawers. Looking from the door, I could see through the “master” bedroom, into the kids’ room, into the bathroom. You’d have to go through the kids’ room to get to the single bathroom. Not so handy while kids are trying to go to sleep, or if you needed to get up before them. The door wall separating the kids’ room and our room was a joke. The curtains didn’t block out any light, so we had to sit with all the lights off and tv off while the kids fell asleep. The room itself was grungy and dirty, an overall icky feeling. I admit I can be picky about hotels, so I didn’t say anything to my husband. But when he said to me, “let’s see what else we can find tomorrow” I knew there was a problem. He is not picky. We ended up switching to the (more expensive by $20 a night) Residence Inn, which was AMAZING. Totally worth it for the week we were in San Diego. Full kitchen, 2 floors, separate room upstairs for adults (and full bath), along with separate room downstairs with blackout curtains on door wall, and another full bath on first floor. Living room with tv and couch, granite countertops in kitchen. The only problem was the steep staircase – my 2-year-old needed to be watched while ascending and descending. Don’t stay at the Comfort Suites with little kids!

Reviews.Title: “Read the Reviews!”
Reviews.Author: ryelo
Reviews.Content: I agree with the other reviews! The kid's suite was a regular room cut in half with a sheer curtain over the french door divider, which offered no privacy whatsoever. The room was old and in need of some major upgrades - the tiles were chipped, floor was filthy, the bed was horribly lumpy and uncomfortable and the pillows were so small and flat, I had to lay all 4 on top of each other! The breakfast was mediocre, at best, because there just was not enough food or space to accomidate the crowded conditions. Every member of the hotel staff we encountered was rude, especially the maid who refused to move her huge bag of garbage so we could get out of the elevator. Unfortunately, we prepaid the room (which was an outrageous $200 per night, which seemed OK at first, since it was a kid's suite) when we booked our Sea World vacation, otherwise we would have walked right back out and stayed somewhere by the ocean for the same price! We did end up leaving 2 days early, and although we did complain to the manager on duty, they were not willing to offer any sort of "satisfaction guarantee". We'll never stay at a Comfort Suites again - you'd be wise to stay away from this one as well!

Reviews.Title: “a place for kids to stay”
Reviews.Author: balletshoes
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I chose this hotel from expedia because it was supposed to be a 2 bedroom suite. We brought his 11 year old along and I didn't want to have to share a 1 bedroom for an entire week with an 11 year old. The pictures and descriptions made this seem to be pretty spacious yet when we checked in it was a regular room split in half. The room was divided by french doors with a mesh curtain that you could see through. The "kid" side had the air conditioning control, and the king bed side only had a fan in the wall. There were kids galore in this hotel. I would hate to see this place when kids are off school. It was a zoo everywhere. From the moment we checked in to the moment we checked out we heard babies crying and kids screaming thoughout. If looking for a peaceful vacation or business travel this is not your place. I suggest it only to families who would understand other families and their kids. And the continental breakfast was decent only problem is finding a table to eat at and a huge line to use one of the waffle makers.

Reviews.Title: “Stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: adoraoo7
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on a business trip and was disappointed with the condition of the room. Since I am a female, I like to have rooms with interior access and always request that my room be on a high floor, however they gave me one with exterior access on the first floor. I'm not sure if they had interior available. Once I was in the room I noticed that it was large but everything in the room seemed old. There was even a spider in my room, which I'm terribly afraid of. I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: yazdnil
Reviews.Content: While planning a trip down to San Diego to visit friends from college, I came across the comfort suites on travelocity and booked my stay. By using travelocity I saved 20%, always a plus! Upon arrival we were welcomed by a very friendly front desk person and were given several lists of restaurant phone numbers and popular San Diego attractions. Our room was perfect! Two room suite, one bedroom and one living room, with a fridge and microwave. The bed was comfortable, and the pillows were plentiful. The bathroom was always stocked with complimentary items. They had a wonderful FREE continental breakfast and FREE parking. I would DEFINITELY stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “UnComfortable Comfort Inn”
Reviews.Author: TravelinTitan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is convenient to the freeway and San Diego attractions. Our visit had several problems, however: - The room smelled of smoke, even though the hotel is "100% non-smoking." - carpets had numerous stains. -the small room had a sliding glass divider which enhanced our feeling of claustrophobia. The doors are noisy, and the thin walls let you know whenever your neighbors open and close theirs. The ventilation fan is like one of those old kitchen ventilation fans that really did nothing but make noise. -there were several groups of college-age kids partying during our visit. Calls to the front desk did not result in noise reductions. In fact, we saw some of the kids walk right past the security guard into the hotel with several cases of beer. -the breakfast room was inadequate for the number of guests, and service staff did not keep food items stocked. -the parking is inadequate for the number of rooms. After searching the lot and up and down the adjacent street, the guard had us park in a "fire zone" spot. -walls are thin and walkway noise is very pronounced. -the worst aspect, though, was the rather overt disregard the hotel management had for our concerns.
