I have never had such a disinterested response to problems we raised with the staff. This is definitely NOT a hotel I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Room not a Suite”
Reviews.Author: GiliRaanana
Reviews.Content: We are a family of five, just return from a 3 week tour in California. This hotel publishes it as a one bedroom suite but it is not other than relative small room divided into 2. It is extremely small for a family so we will never go there again. We spent in the Suite (Small room) 2 nights and paid over 200$ for AAA rate. We spent most of our nights in Comfort Inn & Suites hotels and it was quite OK, rooms were relative clean and large, but this one was a shame. When I called reception and asked for a better Suite I’ve been told “This is what we have and all Suites are the same”

Reviews.Title: “Small Room”
Reviews.Author: djfred
Reviews.Content: By looking @ the pictures, your getting a little clarification of what the room will look like. But let me tell you this the room is really small. Very little room to walk through. When you first walk in the door you'll see the bathroom then its the main bed, and through the French doors its the pull out couch bed or the kids bunk bed which every you choose to stay at. The little Fan on top of the bed is really annoying. The room with the Main bed gets hardly any AC Air. You can get better rooms somewhere else for what your paying for here. Front Desk was rude. The bathroom is roomier then the 2nd room. Room is not clean, stains everywhere. And TV doesn't work properly. I was Staying for 3 Nights, I canceled 2 of the nights and went and got a different hotel. Room Number was 168.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back”
Reviews.Author: horrorqueen99
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and 6 year old son from July 17 through July 22. We had a late check in and the gentleman at the front was quick and polite. I was checked in quickly. He even gave us a printed paper with directions to most attractions in San Diego. We drove to the area where our room was, and contrary to the review below (staying one of the same nights as us), this hotel is not in a bad neighborhood, nor did I feel like I was going to be jumped going from the car to the room. I actually saw more that one security guard on the lot. To get into the hotel, you must use your room key, and you can actually enter from the lobby if that makes you feel more secure. Yes there are trash cans located outside each corridor entrance with sand for cigarette butts, but in the 5 days we were there, they seemed to be kept clean. As there is no smoking in the hotel nor in most of the state of California, these types of trash cans are common pretty much in every city/hotel/restaurant that I have ever been to. While staying here, I did notice that there are several layouts to these rooms. Some with the pull out bed first, some with the bathroom in the back. When you entered our room, the bathroom was immediately to your right, the main bed next, and the extra room/pull out bed behind a sliding door. The A/C is located in this room w/a fan between to pull the air in. The A/C was not noisy, it was very efficient and the fan was fine. It actually was more like white noise to us and we all slept fine. I truly did not find the photos to be misleading at all from their website, the only difference that I saw is that when the photo taken from the extra room, they pulled the table out. I was able to sit at the table with the bed pulled out and work on my computer. The room was not cramped and the three of us moved around just fine. The bathroom was spotless and the carpet clean. The pool was almost too warm the first couple of days but I noticed that they adjusted the temperature later on. It was more refreshing after that. The pool was clean and at a only 4.5 feet deep, nice for the kids. This hotel does sit off of a freeway, but is separated by 3 roads, we heard no traffic at any time. You are also with in walking distance to 3 restaurants. Also, being in Hotel Circle you are within 10-15 minutes of all of the major attractions (that is if SoCal traffic cooperates). I would not hesitate to stay here again and we are already planning our next trip to San Diego and will be booking with Comfort Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Glad to leave”
Reviews.Author: Exmoorgirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and two teenagers for one night. Glad we weren't booked in for any more. The rooms have an outside corridor and coming up from the carpark up the stairs was a bit unnerviing. I half expected to be leapt upon by a drug dealer and a mugger. It reminded me old Council flats in London (are the called tenement blocks in US?). There were buckets of sand with dogends on the outside corridor. Not very pleasant. The suite was divided in two by a sliding door - bunk beds in one half. You had to go through this room to the bathroom. Space is very tight, lighting is awful. I really wouldn't want to spend any more time in this room than I had to. A/C was nosy and right next to the bed - everything is right next to the bed because there is no room to move around. Hotel is noisy on a busy road. Breakfast room was like a school canteen. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “the pictures of rooms are misleading”
Reviews.Author: visitor12
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 night stay at this Comfort suites hotel. I do have to agree with other's comments on the room size. It is very "tight" space, and the "suite" looks like a room divided into 2 with sliding door seperating them. There isn't alot of room to manuever around. Additionally, the A/C unit is opposite where the king bed is in the other room, and the way the hotel has you "circulate" air into this area is by a fan that is placed into the wall. You can see this fan when viewing the pictures on their website. It's is little noisy if you are a light sleeper and have this fan on to circulate air. I do have to agree with others comments about a certain "smell" and not being able to open your window too much. They had a little air scented freshner in the A/C unit. The bathroom was spacious, and updated with tile and granite counters. We didn't participate in the breakfast. The pool area was nice, warm. The lobby staff were very nice, accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel, Cold in MAY!”
Reviews.Author: jasonandkalea
Reviews.Content: Great family hotel. Bring winter clothing in May. Hotel check in was quick. The hotel room is a basic size with 2 separate areas. The room was stacked with the basic bathroom stuff, the room had a fridge, microwave, coffee maker, iron/ board. The room was very clean except "FRED" on the wall. We adopted him as our new roommate. We said goodbye and goodnight to him. The kids were easily amused with the bunk bed. We tucked in a blanket on the top mattress and made a tent. There is Nintendo to play (for a fee of course) . The room was a little tight, but if you are going to be out all day, it shouldn't be that bad. The bathroom was nice. The grounds were landscaped nice, with piped in music. The pool was clean and warm. There are pool towels for you to use. The Breakfast was good. Sausages, hard boiled eggs, make your own waffles, pastries, muffins, bagels, oatmeal, cereal, 3 types of juices, milk, great coffee, fresh fruit (bananas, apples) make sure you take a jacket, its quite chilly in MAY, the inside eating area gets filled fast, so you might have to eat in the courtyard. There is a laundry "room" (its in a big closet) it cost $1.25 for the dryer OR the washer, with a detergent dispenser for $1.00. This hotel is for families, so if you're the anal quiet type looking for a quiet romantic getaway- this is not for you. Everything is really close- a target, Denny's, Benihana, TGI Fridays, the freeway. We were quite content here.

Reviews.Title: “Mislead”
Reviews.Author: Mequontravelor
Reviews.Content: I as well booked this hotel based on the photos. I also called the hotel and asked if the pictures they advertised is what they offered. I also discribed the layout of the room based on the picture to the employee. She then told me that all the rooms have recently been updated and they all should look like that. So, when my family and I got there, and were checking in, I showed the lady the pictures I printed out from there website, and I told her that this is the room I want, and she said, none of our rooms look like that. I then told her, that her hotel is false advertising. You are misleading the consumer. I was very upset, and I will never stay at a Comfort Suites ever again. Once we got to our room, it was tiny and stuffy, and not cleaned all that well. We found candy and an empty kids cup under the bunk beds. It was just not layed out appropriately. There is no place to sit. They really should put the right photos on their website, it is just not right to false advertise.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and reasonale price”
Reviews.Author: DallasLove2travel
Reviews.Content: It's comfortable and clean and nice to stay.We were out most of the day and return in the evening.It is reasonably priced and good for the money. Also loved their continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Okay... but never again...”
Reviews.Author: Nickstr
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of those '2 room suites' its not 2 rooms but rather one with a dividing wall. The rooms are not very comfortable or big and they do have a weird smell. You cant open the windows to let any fresh air in because they have these lock things on them but we broke them and opened the window (as the room really needed fresh air). The breakfast is nothing special (although their muffins and juices were nice). The staff were quite rude....use caution when getting them to call you a cab...they call you this club car thing which has a flat rate and costs more than a cab...they do this because they get a commission out of it (I saw the process taking place). The pool area was nice... and they do have a 24hour gym (which comes in handy if you cant handle your costrophobic room in the middle of the night). Dennys is nearby and a mall is about a ten minute walk over the freeways.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: MNBeth
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay. It was close to everything! We stayed 6 nights with our 4 kids. Lots to choose from for breakfast, the pool was warm. The staff was GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Good Proximity, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: anonymousVa
Reviews.Content: We were looking for an inexpensive place to stay. I found this by chance by googling "hotels in san diego." It was a great find. This place is NOT the WINN!! It's a budget hotel. It's location is within 5-15 minutes of anything you'd want to see in SD (except the Wild Animal Park, which is not in SD). The rooms are spotless. The staff was friendly. I thought the breakfast was more than mediocre. My husband and I eat cereal or instant oatmeal and hot tea/coffee for breakfast each morning on a typical day. This breakfast offered assorted danishes, fresh fruit, yogurt, 2 or 3 kinds of cereal, toast, butter, jams, syrup for your waffles made fresh on these wonderful waffle irons, coffee, tea, milk, orange, apple, papaya juice. I didn't taste the sausage, as this was the one thing that did not look too great. I do agree with other reviewers about the size of the rooms. We did not even get a "suite." See my posted pictures with this review. Our room was a postage stamp just large enough for a king bed, small entertainment center, and a small table and 2 chairs, with NO room to spare. However, we weren't planning on hanging out in our rooms all day. We just needed a clean place to sleep, shower and eat a decent breakfast, and that is exactly what this hotel offers. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom, however, was quite spacious, immaculately clean, and had all necessities, including 6 fresh bath towels every day...and we were only two people in the room! Also, my hubby and I used the hot tub...very nice...very hot. We also got in the pool. Note our stay was in December, gets cool at night. But between hot tub and heated pool, the swim was refreshing and relaxing. The pool area has its own towels. I would surely recommend this place to my friends. It's simple, comfy, inexpensive, and has everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, but have stayed in worse”
Reviews.Author: adb1158
Reviews.Content: Actually a suite wan-a-bee. Large rooms converted to suites, seemed kinda cheesy to me. The breakfast was a bit on the mediocre side. On the positive side, the staff was very friendly and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy!”
Reviews.Author: kgreenaz
Reviews.Content: The rooms are tiny but we loved the kids' suite. The room was well-maintained and the maid service was great. Lots of towels and newly remodeled bathroom. Everything about our room was great except the noise. There was a mini-frig and microwave. The room is great for a family of four and only four. However, the corridors are outside so you could hear everyone who walked by, wheeled their suitcase or used the luggage trolley. People would be making loud noises early in the morning and late at night. Our last two nights were hard because there was a lot of jumping and noise in the room above us. If it were not for the noise, we would stay there again. But I just couldn't recommend it because it is such an important feature.

Reviews.Title: “Never staying there again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sylmart06
Reviews.Content: San Diego- Comfort Suites: Mission Valley We decided to stay here because it was little more affordable than other suites, but by not too much!! The so-called suites are super tiny, it's better if you stay in a standard room. We asked for non-smoking and the room lingered with the smell of cigarette from whomever stayed there before us. Not only that, we requested to be transferred into another room, they said everything was booked, there was nothing they could do. Their remote controls weren't working, we had to replace them with our own batteries. Their pool is very small for such a huge property.

Reviews.Title: “Your needs will determine if this hotel is satisfactory for you”
Reviews.Author: Carlstadt
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Comfort Suites Mission Valley, San Diego, CA for 5 nights in July, 2006 It depends on your needs to determine if this hotel is satisfactory for you. The prior reviews were accurate, but that does not necessarily mean you should not stay here. 1)Parking-As opposed to other hotels in San Diego, parking here is free. The spots surrounded the building, there were quite a number of spots, but still I wonder if one would get shut out if one arrived real late at night. We got back late a few times, did find a spot, but we had to back in , as the spots were tight. If you are a good driver, are adept at backing into a spot, then you will be OK. So, parking is free which is a positive. 2)The breakfast is typical Choice Hotel breakfast, cereals, bread, danishes, juices, coffee and this hotel even had hard boiled eggs too. Aside from the indoor breakfast room, there was an outdoor eating area also. We were earlybirds, so we were able to get an outside table each morning. I don't know why anybody would knock the breakfast at this hotel, it was fine. 3)Location- This hotel was one of many hotels that were near each other. A reference to the AAA Tour Book spotting map will show that there are many hotels in the vicinity. I found the location of this hotel outstanding. It is actually on the service road of one of the freeways. This hotel is centrally located as it is near 3 freeways concurrently. We went to : Wild Animal Park SD Zoo Seaworld Balboa Park Museums SD Airport The Wild Animal Park is a bit of a ride North, but the other places and Airport are minutes from the hotel. In addition, we were not real far from downtown, and visited the shops along the harbor. The entrance to the freeway was just a few blocks from the hotel, what more could you ask for? 4)Movie charge: I just reread one of the reviews before I wrote this, and was incredulous that I had the same thing happen to me. The night before we left, I channel surfed for a few minutes while my wife was packing the luggage. When I got the bill the next morning, there was a charge for a movie. I told the girl that I did not watch a movie, I just channel surfed for a few minutes. She asked if somebody else was in the room with me and I told her my wife was , but she never even touched the TV. She eventually took the movie off the bill, but it took a few minutes to get it straight, and I had a plane to catch at SD Airport. I was not thrilled that I was even doubted. 5)The room itself: decide for yourself: As mentioned in prior reviews, this really was 1 room and a partial wall was installed to make 2 separate areas. You come into the room, and the sleeping area is first. The air conditioner is in the next section, not the section that you sleep in. To circulate the air, they installed a fan IN the wall separating the 2 areas. The fan is by BROAN, the range hood people, and the sound is identical to the sound that your range hood fan makes. We spent each day we were in SD out all day long, and did not return until dark. Entire days at Wild Animal Park, LegoLand, SD Zoo, Museums, Seaworld, so we were pretty tired by the time we got back to the hotel, showered and went to sleep. Somehow, that fan did not bother us and we slept well each night. So, if you can handle a fan whirring over your bed, it will not be an issue, if you are a light sleeper, you will have a problem. There was a desk to work on next to the A/C, so you froze while working at the desk. The cold air did not seem to come into the sleeping area, fan and all. Still, we were able to sleep. Conclusion: You need to decide what is important in your life. I liked the great access to several freeways. I liked the breakfast , it was fine. I liked the free parking, if you found a spot, and know how to back in you will be fine. The place was secure as your plastic room key got you into the outside property doors as well. The hotel was reasonable priced. If you just need a place to have breakfast, sleep and shower you will be OK with this hotel. Downside: The room is claustrophobic as it is real crowded with that wall more a hindrance than a help. I was in an Embassy Suite and that is really a Suite. This may say Comfort Suite, but I do not agree, this is not a suite, simply a room with a wall that divides one room, doing more harm than good. I called Choice Hotels and stated my displeasure with this setup, and the girl told me many of the Comfort Suites are like this. I will make it my business to stay in a regular room next time. I will not turn my back on Choice Hotels, as I have been happy in many other properties that I have stayed in. I once stayed in a Clarion and it was magnificent, and I once stayed in a Sleep Inn that was fabulous. You must really do some soul searching about this particular property, to see if you can deal with a fan over your head while you are trying to sleep. The breakfast, free parking, easy access are all things that are right.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Phoenix Native
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the Comfort Suites Mission Valley for a short vacation trip. The staff was pretty polite and attentive. We had arrived early and had a few hours to kill. We left our luggage with the front desk and they told us to call in a couple hours to see if there were any rooms ready. This was not a problem. We called back and they had a room ready for us. The room was clean and the bathroom looked like it was upgraded. The tile and countertop were really nice. However, there was a stuffiness upon entry. We opened up a window to let the room air out. The set up in the room is pretty good and I liked the idea of having two televisions, came in handy. If you are into fitness, there is an exercise room that consists of one treadmill, a couple of bikes and two eliptical trainer machines. One of the bikes did not work and the treadmill was pretty worn out, made a lot of noise at the higher levels. I was still able to get a good work out with what was there. All and all this place was adequate, nothing fancy but, good for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Clean Hotel w/ Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I really don't understand all the negative comments about this hotel. I have stayed in many, many hotels and motels throughout my life (I used to be an Events Planner for an Internet Company) and I can honestly say that this hotel is nice, for the price range and type of hotel it is. My daughter, mother and I stayed in this hotel for three nights, arriving the first night around 8:30pm. The lobby is very nice- all marble floor, nice designs on wall and a cute fireplace (I think faux-fireplace). I'm always a little leery of night-staff as they tend to be less accomodating and pleasant. However, this was not the case. When I walked in, there was a line of one person with another person at the desk and one staff person helping the guest at the desk. After a minute or so, the staff person, looked directly at me and said that he would be right with me. It did take some time to get waited on, but he was certainly going as fast as possible with each guest while still giving good customer service. When he got to me, he was very pleasant and helpful. We had a family suite- a main room with a second room with a sofabed separated by french doors. Yes, the room is ont he small side, but really, I've stayed in smaller and paid much more for it. The bathroom was nice with a long counter and the shower and toilet were clean and stain-free. The only downside was our room was at the end, next to the door that went out to the parking lot, so we had door noise and people noise, but again, nothing too unbearable and anyway, it was certainly not anything the hotel could be faulted for. The hotel offers a complimentary continental breakfast every morning from 6-9:30am. Very nice, not extravagent, but there were 4 cold cereal choices, instant oatmeal, bagels, bread, pastries. muffins, apples and oranges, milk, coffee, hot chocolate, 2 kinds of juice, a microwave, two toasters and butter and jam. I had several occasions to talk to the front staff and each time it was someone different and each time, they were pleasant and helpful. When we called to request two extra blankets, they arrived within 5 minutes. ON the 2nd night, we arrived late back to the hotel and there were no parking spaces, so the front desk person told me to park in their red zone right outside the lobby overnight. No muss, no fuss. I would certainly stay there again. By the way, they have a very nice pool and hot tub and provide towels right at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and will never stay here again. It was one of the most uncomfortable hotels that my family has ever stayed in. First of all, it was immediately apparent that our "2-room suite" was merely a regular-sized room where they put in a wall with French doors to create 2-rooms. The bedroom is so small that you have to close the drawers in order to walk in front of the bed. Also, the air circulation was extemely poor. The original air conditioner is in the front room. When the French doors are closed, the cool air only hits the front room. In order circulate cool air into the bedroom, they installed a cheap, inefficient circular fan built into the wall to blow the cool air into the bedroom. The front room was freezing, while the bedroom got hardly any air. It was very uncomfortable for my teenaged son, who slept on the sofa bed in the front room. In order to keep him from freezing to death, mgmt brought us a cheap portable fan for our bedroom, so we could turn down the air conditioner. Also, the parking is terrible! The spaces were sooo small that SUVs could barely fit. There were not enough parking spaces for every guest. We definitely will never stay here again. When I complained to the management they said we were welcome to check out and find accomodations elsewhere. Our stay was so bad that we will never stay at any Comfort Inn or any of the CHOICE hotels chain.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Inn- Camino Del Rio South”
Reviews.Author: hspandorf
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel August 2005 for 5 nights. It was okay. I asked for a non-smoking room, but, was placed in a smoking room - which luckily did not smell of smoke. The room was dark and small. The room with the pull out couch did not have a remote. One was found and placed in the room in a timely manner. When the pull out couch was pulled out, there was no space to move around in that room. The bathroom was clean. One of the sheets was torn. Parking was adequate. Limited breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Good for kids.”
Reviews.Author: ScrappingMomof3
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I was a bit hesitant to book this hotel. The few criteria I was looking for was a kid suite type room, complimentary breakfast and free parking. We were only staying 3 mights, so I took a chance. I booked a kid suite room, which has the bunk bed and queen bed with sliding french doors separating the two rooms. Yes, its true it wasn't the biggest of rooms, but the bunk bed and their own TV was a hit with my kids (ages 7 and 4). I've seen better complimentary breakfasts, but all my kids eat is cereal, anyway, and my husband and I were ok with the bagels. I thought the room was clean and the bathroom was larger than I expected. If you are expecting 5 star, don't come here...but my kids loved the pool, which wasn't crowded the time we were there, they loved their bunk bed and their own TV. I also noted the housekeeping staff actually said "Hello" when you passed them in the hallway. The location was also great. We spent the day on Coronado Island and it took all but 15 minutes to get there. The Target and the large shopping mall was across the highway from the hotel. So all in all, I would recommend this hotel for families with young children.

HotelInfo.Name: Comfort Suites Mission Valley
HotelInfo.Address: 631 Camino Del Rio South, San Diego, CA 92108
